title: Civil War Women, North And South
description: This recording comprises two narratives.  One is by Cora Mitchel who in 1861 was a girl in her mid-teens.  Her Unionist family escaped the Confederacy from their home in south Georgia to Rhode Island.  This is her story written about 1916.  The second narrative is by Charlotte St. Julien Ravenel of South Carolina, a contemporary journal written in the closing months of the civil war in 1865. - Summary by David Wales

sections.title: Journal Letter Kept By Miss Charlotte St. J. Ravenel
